item.title: Emilia add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The unexamined life is not worth living." -- Socrates

item.title: Emilia add a quote by Walter Bagehot
item.description: "Life is a compromise of what your ego wants to do, what experience tells you to do, and what your nerves let you do." -- Walter Bagehot

item.title: Emilia add a quote by Voltaire
Emilia add a quote by Sydney Smith
item.description: "we know nothing of tomorrow, our business is to be good and happy today" -- Sydney Smith

item.title: Emilia add a quote by Baz Luhrmann and Craig Pearce
item.description: "Don't be reckless with other people's hearts, And don't put up with people that are reckless with yours." -- Baz Luhrmann and Craig Pearce

item.title: Emilia add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "May your heart always be joyful. May your song always be sung." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Emilia add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Life is divided into the horrible and the miserable." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Emilia add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Emilia add a quote by Kris Kristofferson
item.description: "Freedom's just another word for "nothing left to lose"." -- Kris Kristofferson

item.title: Emilia add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Emilia add a quote by Mark Andrus
item.description: "I can tell you I love you as many times as you can stand to hear it, but all it does is remind us that love is not enough. Not even close." -- Mark Andrus

item.title: Emilia add a quote by Mark Andrus
item.description: "You know the great thing, though, is that change can be so constant you don't even feel the difference until there is one. It can be so slow that you don't even notice that your life is better or worse, until it is. Or it can just blow you away, make you something different in an instant" -- Mark Andrus

item.title: Emilia add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "We're all faced throughout our lives with agonizing decisions, moral choices. Some are on a grand scale, most of these choices are on lesser points. But we define ourselves by the choices we have made. We are, in fact, the sum total of our choices. Events unfold so unpredictably, so unfairly, Human happiness does not seem to be included in the design of creation. it is only we, with our capacity to love that give meaning to the indifferent universe. And yet, most human beings seem to have the ability to keep trying and even try to find joy from simple things, like their family, their work, and from the hope that future generations might understand more" -- Woody Allen

item.title: Emilia add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "You will notice that what we are aiming at when we fall in love is a very strange paradox. The paradox consists of the fact that, when we fall in love, we are seeking to re-find all or some of the people to whom we were attached as children. On the other hand, we ask our beloved to correct all of the wrongs that these early parents or siblings inflicted upon us. So that love contains in it the contradiction: The attempt to return to the past and the attempt to undo the past." -- Woody Allen
